review: The fire tv is ok, not that impressed.  It keeps bumping me off.  Even after getting a booster.  I brought this thinking I would get better service,  then I had gotten on my game system.  But I watch my other tv system more often, because I do not have to deal with interruptions.  I would love to know if I could get my money back.
author: sean

review: Had to get rid of Roku due to an HDMI bug and switched to Fire.  So far we like ti very much and have fun with the voice search option.
author: Samara Castiglia-Chable

review: The picture is so much better in true HD and so fast to access Amazon Prime through the wireless.  Love it!
author: Amazon Customer

review: We like this tv, although navigating through the programs can be frustrating. Getting out of Hulu and Netflix, for example, requires multiple clicks. And, I do miss being able to access our iTunes purchases, as well as seeing the recommended items (which were both available on Apple TV). One nice feature is that you can search by speaking into the microphone on the remote... however, this is only within Amazon Prime selections, and will not work if you want to search for a show in Netflix or Hulu.There are so many choices for programming within Amazon Fire, though, that these complaints seem minor in the end. We don't have cable, and because we have Amazon Fire, it isn't missed.
author: K. Daniel

review: Easy to setup but took a long time to download Netflix. Last night the voice command didn't work and a movie would not download.So far however, still better than Roku.
author: Burt

review: Turned a not so smart TV into a genius! Amazon TV discounts apply to all amazon purchases, gives access to Netflix, Hulu, etc.  Brilliant!
